content.question: Assume that an economy is currently in a recession. If policy-makers do nothing and wages and prices are flexible, which of the following will occur in the long run?

choices.label: The short-run aggregate supply curve will shift to the right, leading to full employment.
The short-run aggregate supply curve will shift to the left, leading to full employment.
The aggregate demand curve will shift to the right, leading to full employment.
The aggregate demand curve will shift to the left, leading to full employment.
The unemployment rate will continue to increase.

content.answer: The short-run aggregate supply curve will shift to the right, leading to full employment.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine the outcome of an economic situation using economic concepts, principles, or models.
